title: Operations Standard â€“ Safety Framework
purpose: The single source of truth for safety, security, and constitutional boundary protection. Defines immutable assets, forbidden behaviors, and mandatory provenance guarantees.

rules.statement: Charter files under .intent/charter/** MUST NOT be modified without a formal constitutional amendment.
Constitutional documents MUST NOT be modified outside formal amendment process.
rules.rationale: Constitution defines the system's fundamental governance rules. Modifications bypass democratic process and create governance chaos.

rules.statement: Core mission definition files MUST NOT be modified without human-in-the-loop amendment.
Core orchestration and governance engines MUST NOT be modified autonomously.
Autonomous agents MUST NOT modify the core autonomy loop implementation.
rules.rationale: Core autonomy loop is the execution engine for autonomous operations. Self-modification creates unbounded recursion and loss of governance.

rules.statement: Source code MUST NOT contain dangerous execution primitives.
Code MUST NOT use eval(), exec(), or shell=True subprocess calls.
rules.rationale: Dynamic code execution bypasses static analysis and creates arbitrary code execution vulnerabilities.

rules.statement: Every file modification MUST be preceded by an audit log entry containing an IntentBundle identifier.

error.description: Critical violation. Blocks merge, deploy, and runtime execution.

warn.description: Non-critical issue. Reported but does not block.

intentguard_deny_rules.description: Domain definitions are core mission assets.
Northstar mission file requires human amendment.
Core orchestration entry point is immutable.

break_glass.description: Emergency override mechanism for governance deadlock or system recovery.
